skillTree.localised_description: The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.

attributes.bullet_text: Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

skillTree.localised_description: Like the lion, this one is the biggest and the bravest of his kind... with the sharpest teeth.
Whereby the power of death itself is used to hold back the physical world.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: According to the stories of nearby peasants villagers, Bougars is a monstrous knight who rides out of the darkness and spears innocents in their beds. He is an ogre who eats children raw. He is a master of black arts who can flay your soul from your body with a word. He is also their liege lord, and the peasants are bound to obey his laws, no matter how insane, on the pain of worse than death. The truth about Bougars is bleakly mundane and no less horrible than the wildest of tales.

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -5
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: All hoped that Duke Merovech’s bloodline had been severed after his death during the invasion of Mousillon by the Duke of Lyonesse. Those hopes were unfounded. Merovech’s bloodline went on, and perhaps it was irredeemably corrupted by Merovech’s madness. It is certain that the latest in Merovech’s line, Bougars de Biaucaire, seems possessed of a madness the equal of the late Duke’s.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases as the unit takes damage

skillTree.localised_description: Many criminals, mostly poachers, are impaled along the path that winds up a hillside towards Bougars' watchtower itself and the heads of poachers and rebels adorn rusting spikes over the doorway. Inside the scenes are infinitely worse..

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Bougars despises Bretonnia and especially the king, since it is because of the nation’s weakling kings that the name of Merovech is now cursed. It was therefore easy for Mallobaude to bring Bougars into his conspiracy, simply by promising him the chance to cover himself in the gore of royal lapdogs and overthrow the kingdom. The role Mallobaude has in mind for Bougars is that of a simple weapon of terror.

effects.description: Attribute: Unbreakable when fighting against Bretonnia

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each enemy entity in range

effects.description: Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Bretonnia

skillTree.localised_description: Bougars has a handful of soldiers who answer to him and whom he sends out to proclaim his laws and execute transgressors. These men are not knights, but psychopaths and killers who serve their insane lord in return for a measure of power over the terrified peasants.

effects.description: +10% chance of Bougars' knights being succesful in their raids

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
This champion extols discipline and fear away from the battlefield as much as on it.

effects.description: Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 10%
Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 20%
Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 30%

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of this warrior, their stature, import or infamy, can have a calming effect.

effects.description: Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 1
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 2
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: "If they know I'm coming then more's the better!"

effects.description: Assault Garrison action: Additional 5% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 30% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: A skilled assassin is a cold-hearted killer and merciless murderer.
Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

effects.description: Assault Units action: Additional 3% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 8% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

items.colour_text: With this sword Bougars enforces his demands and rules on the fearful peasants living under his command.

backgroundSkills.localised_description:
According to peasants' stories, he is a monstrous knight who rides out of the darkness and spears innocents in their beds. He is an ogre who eats children raw. He is a master of black arts who can flay your soul from your body with a word. He is also their liege lord, and the peasants are bound to obey his laws, no matter how insane, on the pain of worse than death.
	The truth about Bougars is bleakly mundane and no less horrible than the wildest of tales. He is a degenerate and a cannibal.

effects.description: A small chance of sending out his knights to raid enemy settlements
